programmes.show_description: When Mildred enters a flower arranging competition, Chrissy offers her a plant from her garden; when Larry sees one in Chrissy's flat, he thinks it's a cannabis plant. S5 E5: How Does Your Garden Grow
Gary bumps into his former talent agent, Sidney Wix, which leads to an unwelcome collaboration with superstar ukulele player, George Formby. S3 E7: Turned Out Nice Again
More hilarious mishaps with the bumbling Mr. Bean, this time as he books into a hotel room and makes himself well and truly at home but locks himself out. E8: Mr. Bean in Room 426
Drama series about a detective who wakes up in what seems to be 1973. Sam and Annie are led into a world of suburban swingers' parties to solve a murder case. Starring John Simm. S2 E4
Sandra sees Paul with another woman, so decides to become hard and ruthless with everybody including her mother and Carol. S6 E3: Honey
A selection of live performances from TV music shows in the 1960s for a genuine taste of the best of the '60s!
Malcolm decides to move out when his mother interferes yet again, and David offers information about the enterprise allowance scheme. S2 E4: Visiting II
Sharon and Tracey work out that Dorien has an important birthday coming up - and decide that the event calls for a celebration whatever she thinks. S12 E8: Forever Young
More mayhem with hapless bumbler Mr. Bean as he struggles to wait in line for an appointment and thinks up some unusual methods to help him sleep. E13: Goodnight Mr. Bean
The last night of the holiday finds both couples packing, but David and Linda decide to slip away and meet for one last time. S2 E7: Adios

A profile of physicist and inventor Richard Garwin, who helped shape history as designer of the first hydrogen bomb and later as a top science adviser on nuclear arms control and other issues.
The Harley-Davidson is a cult legend and like its riders no two are the same. We look at its history from 1903 and the people who choose to ride one of the most interesting motorcycles ever made.
We explore the story of the Allied troops who invaded the beaches of Western Europe for the first time and faced Axis soldiers in Sicily, Salerno and Anzio. Ep2: The Breakout
Examining the history of war tactics. Winning a swift victory by catching the enemy unawares is one of any commander's great dreams. S1 E9
They are the means by which to confuse an enemy - from inflatable decoy tanks to fake radio broadcasts, deception played a key role in the course of WWII. S1 E9: Tools of Deception
When the hotel throws a party where the guests must adopt fancy dress and perform on stage, Amy dresses as a clown and turns David and Linda's romantic duet into a total farce. S3 E7: Party Night
Nellie ensures Aveline and her first granddaughter are brought home in style. Leonora continues to fascinate the Boswell boys. S7 E2
The girls are feeling stressed and ask a doctor for help, but things get worse for Carol when her dad returns home and her sister intends to leave for London. S6 E1: Facing Up to Life
Ethel has fallen in love with an American pilot called Joe, but Wilfred is not at all pleased. S2 E6: Love is a Very Splendid Thing
Lord Meldrum decides to send Teddy overseas, Alf has plans for James, and Lady Lavender insists on a military funeral for her dead parrot. S4 E2 Requiem for a Parrot
Chrissy receives two tickets for a Frank Sinatra concert but does not want them; she instead enjoys being pampered by Jo and Robin as they compete for the tickets. S5 E6: Come Fly With Me
There's been a spare bed in Philip's room since Alan moved out, and Rigsby has no intentions of keeping it empty. S4 E2: Fire And Brimstone
Alf learns that Else has taken out an insurance policy just as he slips on the floor and breaks his leg. S4 E6: Alf's Broken Leg
The girls are feeling stressed and ask a doctor for help, but things get worse for Carol when her dad returns home and her sister intends to leave for London. S6 E1: Facing Up to Life
Nellie ensures Aveline and her first granddaughter are brought home in style. Leonora continues to fascinate the Boswell boys. S7 E2
Miss Courtney informs Mr. Brown and the class that they will be expected to prepare an act for the school talent show in three days time. : After Three
Chrissy receives two tickets for a Frank Sinatra concert but does not want them; she instead enjoys being pampered by Jo and Robin as they compete for the tickets. S5 E6: Come Fly With Me
When Phoebe's husband Donald returns after escaping from a prisoner of war camp in Italy, Gary feels that he must give Phoebe up for good. S3 E8: There's Something About A Soldier
Mr. Bean loses midnight on New Year's Eve, devises an unusual method of transporting his sales shopping home, and wreaks havoc by doing a spot of decorating. E9: Do-It-Yourself, Mr. Bean
Drama series about a detective who wakes up in what seems to be 1973. When a man's wife and daughter are kidnapped and held hostage, Sam tries to focus on the investigation. Starring John Simm. S2 E5
Carol's grandad has gone missing and everybody is out looking for him - this even includes Carol, once she arrives home after a night out... S6 E4: The Never-Ending End
A selection of live performances from TV music shows in the 1960s for a genuine taste of the best of the '60s!
Peggy petitions against the demolition of a disused church, Malcolm has problems at work when receipts go missing, and Brenda has a go at Pamela for trying to set her up with Terry. S2 E5: Missing
Sharon's living back in her council flat and Tracey's still in Chigwell with younger son Travis, but what's become of Dorien and what can bring the Birds back together? S10 E1: Gimme Shelter
The blunderingly inept master of disaster goes for a haircut - but ends up styling the other customers' hair - and causes chaos at a school fun day. E14: Hair by Mr. Bean of London
Several months have passed - Amy is working, but David is still unemployed and lies to her that his doctor has told him he will have a nervous breakdown unless he takes a holiday. S3 E1: Winter Break

On the 7th September 1940, more than 800 German aeroplanes flew up the Thames - it was the opening salvo of the Blitz and ordinary people faced this carnage with extraordinary courage and resilience.
Sir David Jason looks into how the British Secret Service operated during WWI - he visits Belgium and meets people who are war aficionados or experts on methods used to pass messages to allies. Ep1
Examining the history of war tactics. We explore the use of aerial battles, including the Battle of Britain in 1940, in military conflicts. S1 E10
The 'Desert Fox' Field Marshal Rommel seemed to have a sixth sense when it came to Allied plans and positions - we take a look into how Rommel's winning streak was broken. S1 E10: Rommel's Enigma
David persuades a reluctant Amy to spend Christmas in Spain, but Amy regards the trip as more than a coincidence when she sees the Cochrans. S3 E8: Christmas Special
Lilo Lill turns up with some sad news for Freddie, Joey rents a shop and Shifty gets a job as a bus driver. S7 E3
Sandra, Carol and Paul drive to London to help find Carol's sister, but his car breaks down, and try hitchhiking but end up losing their bags. S6 E2: The Maypole
The annual bowls club outing seems to provide an ideal opportunity for Cecil to be alone with May. S2 E7: A Bowl In The Hand
Mabel finds a purse in the street and is rewarded for her honesty, and heartstrings are tugged when the idea of a servants' ball is taken up by Lord Meldrum. S4 E3 Come to the Ball
The youngsters want a party, but George - recalling the last one - is against the idea. Mildred, however, is all for it and gives it her blessing... S6 E1: The Party's Over
Rigsby is ecstatic to learn that he has inherited his Uncle George's fortune but distressed at a clause that he must be happily married. S4 E3: Great Expectations
Do you need a TV licence to watch adverts? Alf doesn't think so. S5 E1: TV Licence
Sandra, Carol and Paul drive to London to help find Carol's sister, but his car breaks down, and try hitchhiking but end up losing their bags. S6 E2: The Maypole
Lilo Lill turns up with some sad news for Freddie, Joey rents a shop and Shifty gets a job as a bus driver. S7 E3
Mr Brown takes in a new student, a feisty Scotsman who speaks in dialect. However, the Scot turns out to be more than anybody can handle. S3 E1: I Belong to Glasgow
